channel.title: WWU Cybersecurity Club
channel.description: Recent content on WWU Cybersecurity Club

item.description: Date: October 8th 2021 Topic: Security Best Practices Slides available here 4:00pm: Did intro stuff and gave overview for todays meeting. 4:05pm: Went over different password managers. 4:10pm: Went over authenticators and different VPN provides (Self hosted vs Paid). 4:15pm: Asked class what some security best practices are and wrote them on whiteboard. 4:20pm: Did a kahoot on what we covered over the meeting so far. 4:55pm: Meeting over.

Date: October 1st 2021 Slides available here 4:00pm: Introduced club and talked about what we’re doing today 4:05pm: Talked about linktree that contains links to everything and the club format 4:10pm: Went over weekly club format and how we can have one meeting with pizza 4:15pm: Went over events to be aware of with the cybersecurity competitions, security awareness competition, and the ACM resume book. 4:20pm: Did officer introductions then let everyone introduce themselves for the next 15 minutes.

item.title: First Meeting Info and Schedule
item.description: New Meeting Info and Schedule! Based on the data from the Doodle poll that was sent out earlier this week, the Cybersecurity Club has decided that the best time to meet would be every Friday from 4:00 PM to 5:00 PM. Thank you to everyone who completed the poll, it is clear that this time best fits the most people possible. The first meeting will be this Friday, October 1st at 4:00 PM in CF 025.

item.title: Meeting Info
item.description: Meeting Info will be posted periodically on this page. 2021-10-01 2021-10-12

item.title: Codebreaker
item.description: Hey Everyone! This is just a reminder that the NSA’s CTF style challenge “codebreakers” is still ongoing and doesn’t end until December 31st. Make sure to check out the #codebreaker-2021 channel in our discord for hints or more info! Thank you!

item.title: CyberForce 2021 Competition Starts Soon
item.description: Cybersecurity Club is interested in students to join us for the CyberForce competition! The Department of Energy hosts an annual competition called “CyberForce”. This competition focuses on defense and securing networks from attacks as opposed to traditional competitions focused on attack. Last year students were tasked with defending a wind farm and this year we are defending a hydroelectric dam. These scenarios are modeled after real world infrastructure and give students extremely valuable experience.

item.title: WWU Cybersecurity Certificate
item.description: New WWU Cybersecurity Certificate Available! Hey everyone! WWU has created a 16 credit Cybersecurity certificate! Its offered on the Bellingham and Poulsbo campuses, and is open to most students (Sadly, Computer Science department majors are not eligible). For more info check out the link here. We encourage everyone interested to check it out!

item.title: Club Update
item.description: The Cyber Security club is back! It’s currently being rebuilt by Noah (Co-President), Sid (Co-President), Nathan, and Douglas. We aim to have everything up and running before the first week of class (September 22nd). Check back here soon for more information on the club, events, and other happenings. Our main method of communication has been discord, the link for which can also be found at the contact and about pages.

item.description: About Us Co-leaders: Noah, Computer Science Major Sid, Cyber Security Major Webmaster/Secretary: Nathan, Cyber Security Major Officers: Douglas, Cyber Security + Physics Major

item.title: Resources
item.description: Blogs & News Krebs on Security Cisco Talos Kayne McGladrey Arstechnica Daniel Miessler Phoronix Ycombinator HackerNews Programming and Computer Science: Tutorials and Resources Programming Codecademy Learn You a Haskell Computer Science and Operating Systems Operating Systems: Three Easy Pieces Computer Networks: A Systems Approach Linux Academy (requires a (free) account) Resource Dumps What Every CS Student Should Know Open Source Computer Science Degree Curated Programming Resources OWASP Security Cheatsheet Security Portswigger Academy (Webapp Pentesting) Cloud AWS Training Tools & Other Markdown Tutorial Github Git Handbook The Git Book (overkill for beginners) Vimtutor: If you’ve installed vim, simply run vimtutor in your shell CTF Resources CTF Time CBT Nuggets: How to Prepare For a CTF Competition Cybrary: CTF Introduction (useful links at the bottom) Youtube LiveOverflow: What is CTF?

item.title: Western Washington University Cybersecurity Club
item.description: Welcome to the Cybersecurity Club! We’re looking forward to having a great year in 2021 & 2021. Check out the calendar page for our future activities. Our plans for this year include: Capture-the-Flag competitions and CCDC practice CCNA and networking study sessions Creating virtual testing environments on top of physical hardware Trips to visit security companies & teams Internship and job-seeking guidance, resume reviews, etc Links Our Github Our Discord (Anyone with a WWU email can join.
